ProgramElementMissionDescription.val: The CNO's ASW initiative is a focused effort to identify the most promising ASW technologies through a process of discovery, assessment, experimentation, and analysis. The CNO's ASW initiative will coordinate the development of technologies which move beyond incremental or marginal improvements in ASW effectiveness. The CNO's vision of "fundamentally changing the way ASW is currently conducted to render the enemy submarine irrelevant against US and coalition forces" necessitates a change in the calculus of how the US Navy conducts ASW. Central to the CNO's ASW initiatives achieving the CNO's vision are several innovative approaches which include using the art-of-the-technologically-possible; minimizing force-on-force; reducing the ASW end-to-end time line; supporting rapid maneuver; developing off-board and distributed ASW detection systems; and finding innovative weapons solutions. To achieve these key approaches, it is essential to develop new ASW technologies and conduct at-sea experiments to prove/disprove technology concepts and collect corroborating data.

SummaryExplanation.val: Decrease in the Surface ASW program by $45K as required for the Department of the Navy to comply with the Bipartisan Budget Act of 2015.

ProjectMissionDescription.val: The CNO's ASW initiative is a focused effort to identify the most promising ASW technologies through a process of discovery, assessment, experimentation, and analysis. The CNO's ASW initiative will coordinate the development of technologies which move beyond incremental or marginal improvements in ASW effectiveness. The CNO's vision of "fundamentally changing the way ASW is currently conducted to render the enemy submarine irrelevant against US and coalition forces" necessitates a change in the calculus of how the US Navy conducts ASW. Central to the CNO's ASW initiatives achieving the CNO's vision are several innovative approaches which include using the art-of-the-technologically-possible; minimizing force-on-force; reducing the ASW end-to-end time line; supporting rapid maneuver; developing off-board and distributed ASW detection systems; and finding innovative weapons solutions. Text.val: Collected systems and performance data during select Fleet exercises and at-sea testing events. Analyzed and distributed collected data. Conducted studies and Analysis of Alternatives (AoA) in support of the CNO's ASW initiative. Awarded an advanced development contract to improve surface active sonar performance (4Q15).
Collect systems and performance data during select Fleet exercises and at-sea testing events. Analyze and distribute collected data. Conduct studies and AoA in support of the CNO's ASW initiative.

Collect systems and performance data during select Fleet exercises and at-sea testing events. Analyze and distribute collected data. Conduct studies and AoA in support of the CNO's ASW initiative. Award an advanced development contract to prototype promising new ASW concept(s).

AcquisitionStrategy.val: Use competitively awarded contracts from Broad Agency Announcement (BAA) solicitations and University Affiliated Research Centers (UARCs).

PerformanceMetrics.val: Investigate promising ASW technologies via annual at-sea experiments.

Remarks.val: *Consists of multiple performing activities with funding for each not greater than $1M per year.
